result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Jose Erickson

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.

11:17 AM  Defendant Carlos Jose Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Carlos Jose Erickson.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a modification of Defendant's current $2,000 cash bail, and provides arguments to support such a modification.  State argues that cash bail is appropriate given the circumstances surrounding the Defendant's most recent serious charges.  Court finds that the cash bail currently set is appropriate and denies the modification.  State to prepare order.
Bail/bond hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Carlos Jose Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Carlos Jose Erickson.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement received.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Defendant is intending to file request for substitution.
Offer deadline 10-07-2022
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:29 am.

1:51 PM - Defendant Carlos Jose Erickson in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant, in person.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Carlos Jose Erickson
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 2009 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of intimidate victim, battery-dvo, resist officer and disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with S.T., DOB: 02-11-1979; A.T., DOB: 09-01-2007; O.T., DOB: 02-28-2009 or the residence of 2009 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Court will allow a one-time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
